intro: Atriplex novae-zelandiae, commonly known as New Zealand saltbush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. It is well adapted to coastal and saline soils, making it a hardy species in harsh conditions. Atriplex novae-zelandiae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
